sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using iterative methods
message_2:
To apply the Jacobi iterative method, we first rewrite the given system of linear equations as:

\begin{align*}
x &= \frac{1}{3}(5 - y) \\
y &= \frac{1}{-2}(-1 - x - z) \\
z &= \frac{1}{3}(10 - y)
\end{align*}

Now, we will use the Jacobi iterative method with the initial vector $\vec{x}^{(0)} = [0, 0, 0]^T$. We will iterate until the solution converges to four decimal places.

Iteration 1:
\begin{align*}
x^{(1)} &= \frac{1}{3}(5 - 0) = 1.6667 \\
y^{(1)} &= \frac{1}{-2}(-1 - 0 - 0) = 0.5000 \\
z^{(1)} &= \frac{1}{3}(10 - 0) = 3.3333
\end{align*}

Iteration 2:
\begin{align*}
x^{(2)} &= \frac{1}{3}(5 - 0.5000) = 1.5000 \\
y^{(2)} &= \frac{1}{-2}(-1 - 1.6667 - 3.3333) = 2.5000 \\
z^{(2)} &= \frac{1}{3}(10 - 0.5000) = 3.1667
\end{align*}

Iteration 3:
\begin{align*}
x^{(3)} &= \frac{1}{3}(5 - 2.5000) = 0.8333 \\
y^{(3)} &= \frac{1}{-2}(-1 - 1.5000 - 3.1667) = 2.3333 \\
z^{(3)} &= \frac{1}{3}(10 - 2.5000) = 2.5000
\end{align*}

Iteration 4:
\begin{align*}
x^{(4)} &= \frac{1}{3}(5 - 2.3333) = 0.8889 \\
y^{(4)} &= \frac{1}{-2}(-1 - 0.8333 - 2.5000) = 2.1667 \\
z^{(4)} &= \frac{1}{3}(10 - 2.3333) = 2.5556
\end{align*}

Iteration 5:
\begin{align*}
x^{(5)} &= \frac{1}{3}(5 - 2.1667) = 0.9444 \\
y^{(5)} &= \frac{1}{-2}(-1 - 0.8889 - 2.5556) = 2.2222 \\
z^{(5)} &= \frac{1}{3}(10 - 2.1667) = 2.6111
\end{align*}

We can see that the solution is converging. Continuing the iterations, we get:

Iteration 6: $x^{(6)} = 0.9259, y^{(6)} = 2.2037, z^{(6)} = 2.5926$

Iteration 7: $x^{(7)} = 0.9321, y^{(7)} = 2.2099, z^{(7)} = 2.5968$

Iteration 8: $x^{(8)} = 0.9300, y^{(8)} = 2.2100, z^{(8)} = 2.5967$

Iteration 9: $x^{(9)} = 0.9303, y^{(9)} = 2.2098, z^{(9)} = 2.5967$

At this point, the solution has converged to four decimal places: $x \approx 0.9303, y \approx 2.2098, z \approx 2.5967$.
